oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Elizabeth C. Grissim's oath of amnesty

oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Tennessee -- History -- Civil War, 1861-1865; Loyalty oaths -- United States; Allegiance -- United States
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Document verifying the oath of amnesty sworn by Elizabeth C. Grissim of Smith County, Tennessee.
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: United States -- Provost Marshall's Office
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: As much of Tennessee remained loyal to the Federal government and Federal forces occupied Tennessee from early in the war, many Tennesseans signed oaths of amnesty before the end of the war. The growing number of Federal loyalists made it easier for Tennessee to rebuild its governmental infrastructure long before other Southern states were able to do so.
